name: onboarding-agent
description: Scans a codebase and generates a comprehensive onboarding guide for new developers. Maps project structure, identifies architecture patterns, reads key source files, and produces an actionable guide covering setup, architecture, key concepts, and common tasks.

custom_tools.name: find_source_files
custom_tools.description: Find all source code files excluding node_modules, .git, build artifacts, and virtual environments. Covers Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Go, Java, Ruby, PHP, Rust, C/C++, Shell scripts.

custom_tools.name: find_config_files
custom_tools.description: Find configuration and manifest files: package.json, requirements.txt, pyproject.toml, Cargo.toml, go.mod, Dockerfile, docker-compose.yml, Makefile, tsconfig.json, .env.example, and deployment configs.

custom_tools.name: find_docs
custom_tools.description: Find documentation files: Markdown (.md), reStructuredText (.rst), and text files (.txt). Excludes node_modules, .git, and vendor directories.

custom_tools.name: count_by_extension
custom_tools.description: Count files by extension to understand language distribution. Groups files by extension, sorted most to least common.
custom_tools.command: find {{path}} -type f -not -path '*/node_modules/*' -not -path '*/.git/*' -not -path '*/dist/*' -not -path '*/build/*' -not -path '*/__pycache__/*' -not -path '*/venv/*' -not -path '*/.venv/*' -not -path '*/vendor/*' -not -path '*/target/*' | awk -F. 'NF>1 {print $NF}' | sort | uniq -c | sort -rn | head -30

custom_tools.name: grep_pattern
custom_tools.description: Search for a regex pattern across source files. Use for finding routes, handlers, models, exports, entry points, and other code patterns.
